title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Touro - macho inteiro (não castrado)
Boi - macho castrado
Novilha - fêmea antes do primeiro parto (geralmente com idade inferior a 18-24 meses)
Vaca - fêmea adulta que já pariu
Vitelo - animal jovem (macho ou fêmea)
Parto - ato ou efeito de parir





Bull - uncastrated male
Steer - castrated male
Heifer - female that has not had a calf (with less than 18-24 months of age)
Cow - adult female that has had a calf
Calf - young animal either male or female
Calving - the act of parturition in cattle

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Bull - uncastrated male
Steer - castrated male
Heifer - female that has not had a calf (with less than 18-24 months of age)
Cow - adult female that has had a calf
Calf - young animal either male or female
Calving - the act of parturition in cattle

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Suínos

Varrasco - macho inteiro (não castrado)
Porco - macho castrado
Marrã - fêmea antes do primeiro parto
Porca - fêmea adulta que já pariu
Leitão - animal jovem macho ou fêmea
Parto - ato ou efeito de parir

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Swine

Boar - uncastrated male
Barrow - castrated male
Gilt - female that has not had a litter
Sow - adult female that has had a litter
Pig - young animal either male or female
Farrowing - the act of parturition in swine

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Ovinos

Carneiro - macho inteiro (não castrado)
Malata - fêmea antes do primeiro parto
Ovelha - fêmea adulta que já pariu
Cordeiro - animal jovem macho ou fêmea
Parto - ato ou efeito de parir

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Sheep

Ram - uncastrated male
Wether - castrated male
Ewe - female that has not had a a lamb
Lamb - adult female that has had a calf
Lambing - the act of parturition in sheep

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Caprinos

Bode - macho inteiro (não castrado)
Chibo - bode novo
Capado - bode ou chibo castrado
Anaca - fêmea antes do primeiro parto
Cabra - fêmea adulta que já pariu
Cabrito - animal jovem (macho ou fêmea)
Parto - ato ou efeito de parir

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Goats

Buck - uncastrated male
Wether - castrated male
Nanny - adult female that has had a kidding
Kid - youg goat (male or female)
Kidding - the act of parturition in goats

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Cavalos

Garanhão - macho inteiro (não castrado)
Potranca - fêmea antes do primeiro parto (com menos de 2 anos)
Égua - fêmea adulta que já pariu
Poldro/Poldra - animal jovem
Parto - ato ou efeito de parir

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Horses

Stalion - uncastrated male
Gelding - castrated male
Mare - adult female over two years of age
Filly - female with less than two years of age that has not had a foal
Foal - young horse (male or female)
Foaling - the act of parturition in horses

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Galinhas

Galo - macho inteiro (não castrado)
Capão - macho castrado
Galinha - fêmea adulta
Frango - macho jovem
Franga - fêmea jovem
Pintainho - animal muito jovem (macho ou fêmea)
Postura - saída do ovo do corpo da galinha

title: Terminologia Zootécnica - Animal Science Terminology
text:
Chickens

Rooster - uncastrated male chicken
Capon - castrated male chicken
Hen - female chicken
Cockerel - sexually imature male
Pullet - sexually immature female
Broiler - young chicken at market weight (male or female)
Chick - very young chicken not yet at market weight
Laying - act of parturition in chickens

title: Website for PAS-AGRO-PAS Project Researchers
text: PAS-AGRO-PAS Researcher Website Template is a customizable template designed specifically for researchers associated with the PAS-AGRO-PAS project. This template provides a streamlined, user-friendly way for researchers to create their own professional academic websites. The template includes sections for introducing research interests, showcasing publications, sharing project updates, and highlighting academic achievements.

title: Website for PAS-AGRO-PAS Project Researchers
section: Key features of the template include:
text:
Key features of the template include:

Responsive Design: Ensures that the website is accessible and visually appealing on various devices, including desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
Customization Options: Users can easily modify the layout, colors, and content to match their personal or institutional branding.
Pre-Formatted Sections: Ready-made sections for bio, research interests, publications, projects, and contact information to help researchers quickly set up their site.

This template is ideal for researchers who want to maintain an online presence, share their work, and connect with the academic community.

Visit the Website: https://github.com/PAS-AGRO-PAS/ResearcherWebsiteTemplate

title: The use of seemingly unrelated regression to predict the carcass composition of lambs
text: The aim of this study was to develop and evaluate models for predicting the carcass composition of lambs. Forty male lambs were slaughtered and their carcasses were cooled for 24 hours. The subcutaneous fat thickness was measured between the 12th and 13th rib and breast bone tissue thickness was taken in the middle of the second sternebrae. Left side of carcasses was dissected and the proportions of lean meat (LMP), subcutaneous fat (SFP), intermuscular fat (IFP), kidney and knob channel fat (KCFP), and bone plus remainder (BP) were obtained. Models were fitted using the seemingly unrelated regression (SUR) estimator which is novel in this area, and compared to ordinary least squares (OLS) estimates. Models were validated using the PRESS statistic. Our results showed that SUR estimator performed better in predicting LMP and IFP than the OLS estimator. Although objective carcass classification systems could be improved by using the SUR estimator, it has never been used before for predicting carcass composition.

title: The use of seemingly unrelated regression to predict the carcass composition of lambs
text: The aim of this study was to develop and evaluate models for predicting the carcass composition of lambs. Forty male lambs were slaughtered and their carcasses were cooled for 24 hours. The subcutaneous fat thickness was measured between the 12th and 13th rib and breast bone tissue thickness was taken in the middle of the second sternebrae. Left side of carcasses was dissected and the proportions of lean meat (LMP), subcutaneous fat (SFP), intermuscular fat (IFP), kidney and knob channel fat (KCFP), and bone plus remainder (BP) were obtained. Models were fitted using the seemingly unrelated regression (SUR) estimator which is novel in this area, and compared to ordinary least squares (OLS) estimates. Models were validated using the PRESS statistic. Our results showed that SUR estimator performed better in predicting LMP and IFP than the OLS estimator. Although objective carcass classification systems could be improved by using the SUR estimator, it has never been used before for predicting carcass composition.

title: predmicror: Fitting predictive microbiology models in r
text:
predmicror
predmicror is a compilation of predictive microbiology models frequently applied to experimental data. The first release features a range of the most widely used full, reduced, and no-lag growth models.
